intro: Cousinia elegans, commonly known as the elegant cousinia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are usually gray-green and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers range from white to pink in color. Cousinia elegans is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens with well-drained soil and full sun.
